intro: Lasiorrhiza achilleifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants.
